page.title: 12HISTORIC BUILDINGS IN DACRE.
page.content: Home of the Hasell Family,Dalemain is a most attractive house with a fine Georgian facade of pinkish_grey ashlar,situated about half amile from the village and faces the River Eamont. Sir Edward Hasell bought the estate in 1679,his son added to the house its East front and sides in about 1740-50.Most of the West wing is much older,probably 15th or early 16th century;it incorporates a former tower and a newel staircase and a large medieval Hall.The tower is probably another of the line of the pele towers to which Dacre Castle belongs.The house is owned by the McCosh Family direct descendants of the Hasell Family.The house is open to the public during the summer,about 16000visitors per season.There is a licensed restaurant,shop,museums and deer park.
